metadata.title: From Market Failures to the Vulnerabilities and Logical Flaws of 'Artificial' Environmental Protection Systems
metadata.description: Following the Paris Agreement, global actors intensified climate action through ambitious pledges, financial alliances, and investments in green technologies. However, despite continued rises in atmospheric carbon concentrations and global temperatures, a series of structural regressions have emerged, exposing the deep vulnerabilities and fundamental flaws of artificial systems designed to drive socio-economic systems towards resilience. These systems, largely shaped by mainstream economic worldviews, commodify nature and rely heavily on subjective cost-benefit analyses. This article argues that such approaches cultivate an eco-deficit culture, which erodes resilience and public trust. Drawing on Granular Interaction Thinking Theory (GITT), the paper explores the roots of these systemic weaknesses and proposes a corrective mechanism: the semiconducting principle, in which environmental values may be converted into monetary equivalents but not vice versa. The article concludes by calling for the adoption of an eleventh progressive cultural value—protecting and healing nature—as foundational to building an eco-surplus culture and achieving authentic sustainability.

data.title: From Market Failures to the Vulnerabilities and Logical Flaws of 'Artificial' Environmental Protection Systems

metadata.title: INTEGRATED EDUCATION AND SUPPORT FOR INTEGRATED STUDENTS
metadata.description: In this study, the idea of integrating education began to be discussed along with differentiation and individualization in public education. If the differentiation of primary school education requires the level of readiness for independent work with books, textbooks and other literature, as well as the active formation of interests at primary school age, then the basis of integration can be deepened, clarified and expanded by some general concepts that are the objects of study of various subjects. The main goal of integrating education is to direct the child to express his attitude to the laws of their development by forming a good idea of nature and society in primary school.

data.title: INTEGRATED EDUCATION AND SUPPORT FOR INTEGRATED STUDENTS

metadata.title: A REVIEW ON: Medicinal Chemistry:Understanding Drug Action and Behaviour within the Human Body
metadata.description:
Unlocking the Secrets of Drug Action: A Journey Inside the Human Body 
Understanding how drugs interact with our bodies is crucial for developing effective treatments 
and minimizing adverse effects. This abstract explores the intricate dance between drugs and 
our biological systems, focusing on key aspects:
 
Pharmacokinetics: This describes the drug's journey through the body, from absorption into 
the bloodstream to its distribution, metabolism, and elimination. Factors like route of 
administration, drug solubility, and liver enzymes influence this journey.
 
Pharmacodynamics: This focuses on the drug's effects at the molecular level, including its 
target site (e.g., a specific protein or receptor) and the mechanism of action (e.g., activating or 
inhibiting a pathway).

Individual Variability: No two bodies are alike. Age, genetics, and disease state can 
significantly alter drug response, highlighting the need for personalized medicine.
By understanding these principles, we can optimize drug therapy, minimize side effects, and 
facilitate more targeted and effective treatments.

data.title: A REVIEW ON: Medicinal Chemistry:Understanding Drug Action and Behaviour within the Human Body

metadata.title: DATA-DRIVEN MENTAL HEALTH SURVEILLANCE: LEVERAGING SOCIAL MEDIA AND EHRS WITH ETHICAL TRANSPARENCY
metadata.description:
Mental health challenges are on the rise globally, necessitating innovative and scalable surveillance strategies.
This paper investigates how social media data and Electronic Health Records (EHRs) can be integrated using data
analytics and artificial intelligence to detect early mental health patterns. It reviews cutting-edge methods prior to
May 2023, including natural language processing (NLP), federated learning, and explainable AI (XAI), while
emphasizing the need for privacy-preserving practices and ethical oversight. A real-time suicide prevention
system pilot is discussed as a case study. The paper aims to serve as a roadmap for ethically sound implementation
of AI in public mental health monitoring. Furthermore, it considers the role of cross-sector collaboration,
algorithm accountability, and equitable access in shaping the future of scalable and compassionate mental health
technologies.

journal.title: International Journal of Engineering Technology Research & Management (IJETRM)

data.title: DATA-DRIVEN MENTAL HEALTH SURVEILLANCE: LEVERAGING SOCIAL MEDIA AND EHRS WITH ETHICAL TRANSPARENCY

metadata.title: THE IMPORTANCE OF PEDAGOGICAL COMPETENCE AND CREATIVITY IN EDUCATION
metadata.description:
This study provides information about the main essence of competence and creativity in pedagogical education. It is also stated that teachers are required to have creativity, pedagogical approaches and psychological potential when using new methods in education.

Effective organization of education is of great importance in the use of modern research, scientific research and pedagogical methods in education. This study provides recommendations for future teachers to improve their creativity skills.

data.title: THE IMPORTANCE OF PEDAGOGICAL COMPETENCE AND CREATIVITY IN EDUCATION

metadata.title: Dataset: Svalbard Marginal Ice Zone Campaign 2024 - a distributed network of temperature, waves in ice, and sea ice drift observations
metadata.description:
Data release SvalMIZ-24:

These are the data release files for the SvalMIZ-24 dataset. The SvalMIZ-24 expedition took place in April-May 2024. 34 OpenMetBuoys (OMBs) were deployed from the Norwegian Coast Guard ship KV-Svalbard, North-East and North from Svalbard.

Temperature (1-meter air, 10-cm air, surface, and snow-ice), geographic location (ice-drift), and wave data for 34 drifting buoys in the Arctic MIZ. For information on the campaign, see the referenced Cruise Report below. For quality control and usage information, please see the referenced data paper below.

Buoy observations and flags:

2024_KVS_deployment_flagged.nc

In situ data of snow depth and sea-ice thickness data at the deployment site of the buoys:

SvalMIZ-24_SnowDepth-IceThickness.csv

data.title: Dataset: Svalbard Marginal Ice Zone Campaign 2024 - a distributed network of temperature, waves in ice, and sea ice drift observations

metadata.title: TEACHER TRAINING AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT  FOR INCLUSIVE EDUCATION
metadata.description:
Inclusive education aims to ensure that all students, regardless of their diverse abilities, backgrounds, or needs, receive quality education in a supportive and equitable environment. However, the successful implementation of inclusive education relies heavily on the capacity and preparedness of teachers to meet the varied learning requirements of their students. Teacher training and professional development are crucial components in equipping educators with the necessary skills, knowledge, and strategies to support inclusive practices effectively in the classroom.

This paper explores the importance of comprehensive teacher training and continuous professional development in fostering inclusive education. It discusses the key components of inclusive education training programs, including differentiation, Universal Design for Learning (UDL), classroom management for diverse learners, and the use of assistive technologies. Furthermore, the paper highlights the challenges teachers face, such as a lack of resources, insufficient training, and limited institutional support, which can hinder the successful implementation of inclusive education.

The research also examines the role of ongoing professional development in enhancing teachers' ability to address the needs of students with disabilities, students from marginalized backgrounds, and those requiring additional support. Effective professional development programs are those that provide teachers with practical, hands-on strategies, as well as opportunities for collaboration and reflection. Additionally, the paper emphasizes the importance of building a culture of inclusivity within schools, where teachers are supported and encouraged to continuously develop their skills.

journal.title: Scholarly Research Journal for Humanity Science & English Language

data.title: TEACHER TRAINING AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT  FOR INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

metadata.title: Dyadic drumming with rhythmic distraction
metadata.description:
This dataset contains MIDI and body motion data collected during an experiment investigating dyadic drumming with and without rhythmic distraction. 

Experiment design

25 pairs of adults (of which 1 pair was excluded for not following instructions) were tasked with drumming (on MIDI-enabled drums) a regular beat in synchrony with each other at a prescribed tempo (75 bpm). While drumming, they heard a metronome that they were instructed to ignore. The noise profile of the metronome was manipulated to contain long-range autocorrelations (LRC), short-range autocorrelations (SRC), or white noise (WN). The metronome's pitch was also manipulated to form a consonant (perfect 5th) or dissonant chord (diminished 5th) alongside the participants' drum tones. Each pair of participants performed 12 experimental trials with metronome manipulations and 1 baseline trial without any metronome. 

Data

Rhythmic stimuli. Participant dyads were randomly assigned to one of three stimulus groups. For each group, four different stimuli were generated with each type of noise (LRC, SRC, WN). This meant that dyads could play with a different stimulus in every trial and never hear the same stimulus twice. Rhythmic stimuli files comprise lists of interbeat intervals (in miliseconds), which were fed into a metronome in Max/MSP. 

MIDI data. We collected MIDI data showing the timing of participants' drumstrikes and metronome tones in milliseconds, along with MIDI velocity values. MIDI files contain data from all trials (including the baseline, labelled as trial "0") and details about metronome distraction conditions. 

  • P1.txt contains data from participants who were randomly labelled as P1
  • P2.txt contains data from participants who were randomly labelled as P2
  • Metronome.txt contains data from the metronome 

Data from a given trial and dyad can be reconstructed based on the dyad and trial labels in the files. 

Motion data. Head and hand motion data were collected with a 12-camera infrared motion capture system (Qualisys). Motion files contain 3D position data for participants P1 and P2 along with details about metronome distraction conditions.

Timestamps for MIDI and motion data. MIDI and motion data were aligned for each participant and trial by matching the sequence of MIDI interbeat intervals with the sequence of inter-strike intervals obtained from the participant's drumstick motion. Following this matching, we selected the 2-minute period with the most drumstrikes, then removed the first and last 5 seconds, resulting in 110 seconds of data. The MIDI and motion files in the uploaded dataset retain their original timestamps but have been trimmed to include only activity from this 110 second period.

metadata.title: Impact of UPI (Unified Payment Service) on business of Handicraft sector: A case study of Terracotta crafts at Panchmura in Bankura
metadata.description:
Abstract:

This study analyzes the role of online payment (UPI) in development of Terracotta pottery items at Panchmura village in Bankura district. Panchmura village is famous for its wide range of Terracotta items. The long neck Terracotta horse and elephants are produced in this region. This Terracotta items are very popular craft items and symbolizes the culture of the district. It not only adorns the interior of houses but having a religious values and folk identity as well. For this research a number of 50 sample artisans (respondents) were taken to collect database. Both the qualitative and quantitative data was collected to explore the role of digital payment services on sales of the pottery items and satisfaction of the customers. It also tries to explore how much online payment services influences the sell frequency, satisfaction of consumers and overall business assessment. For this analysis basic statistical tools like mean, percentage analysis, Chi-square method, rank distribution analysis is administered to found the significance of the relationship between selected variables. It is found that besides the conventional business channel (cash transaction) this online payment gives a true impetuous in pottery business and helps to secure their earning through bank transactions.

creators.name: Sen, Atanu
creators.affiliation: Asst. Professor in Geography Panchmura Mahavidyalaya, Bankura

keywords: Keywords: UPI, Terracotta, Digital payment service, customer satisfaction

journal.title: International Journal of Advance and Applied Research

data.title: Impact of UPI (Unified Payment Service) on business of Handicraft sector: A case study of Terracotta crafts at Panchmura in Bankura

metadata.title: Predicting Flight Prices by using Neural Networks and Regression
metadata.description:
The objective of the Flight Fare Prediction System is to help travellers plan their trips and manage their finances by offering accurate estimates of flight ticket prices. Frequent variations in airfare for the same flight often pose challenges for securing economical options. This predictive model resolves such issues by estimating ticket prices, helping users save money and understand price trends better. The strategy makes use of sophisticated machine learning techniques and historical flight data to ensure dependable fare predictions. Key factors, such as departure times, airlines, travel dates, destinations, and other pertinent information and analysed to discern patterns influencing pricing.

The system incorporates a number of machine learning strategies, such as Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, and Support Vector Regression. By delivering fare estimates and insights into pricing trends, this system enables users to make informed booking choices. Its integration into flight booking platforms provides a useful resource for travellers to find cost-effective options and plan trips with ease.
keywords: Machine learning, neural networks, and airline fare forecasting, Flight Data Analysis.
references: 1.	Tziridis, K. (2017, October 26). Flight prices prediction using machine learning techniques. 25th Conference on European Signal Processing (EUSIPCO), IEEE.
2.	Brown, N., & Taylor, J. (2004). Flight fare: Tales, poetry, and essays on flight. Books by Sarabande.
3.	Purey, P. (n.d.). Using neural networks and regression analysis to predict stock market close prices.
4.	ResearchGate. (n.d.). Proposed framework for airfare price prediction using public data sources. Retrieved from https://www.researchgate.net/publication/335936877
